intro: Perezia squarrosa subsp. cubataensis, commonly known as the Cuban perezia, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in coastal areas or limestone soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
